summary: tim durkan photographed aerial shots of the sunset warming the city 's skyline and shared them on cnn ireport . the fires were started in southeastern siberia , by farmers burning grass in their fields . the flames quickly grew out of control because of strong winds and spread throughout the region .

aspect: 1. Fiery sunsets in Washington, Seattle, caused by Siberian wildfires, with smoke carrying the reddish hue across the Pacific.
2. Seattle locals marvel at sunsets caused by Siberian wildfires, with smoke filtering out shorter wavelength colors.
3. Washington state experiences fiery sunsets due to Siberian wildfires, with smoke dissipating as air quality improves.
explain: The core idea of this aspect is that the wildfires in Siberia have caused the sunsets in Washington and Seattle to appear fiery and reddish. The smoke from the fires has carried the reddish hue across the Pacific and, as a result, these cities have been able to witness these striking sunsets.

The given aspect focuses on the way in which the Siberian wildfires have influenced the Seattle sunsets. The wildfires have resulted in smoke that filters out shorter wavelength colors, causing the sunset to appear different than it would in normal conditions. This core idea highlights the impact of the wildfires on the natural world and the way in which humans experience it.

The aspect discusses the improvement in the air quality of Washington state due to the dissipation of smoke caused by Siberian wildfires. The fires had originally led to fiery sunsets in the region, but as the smoke cleared, people were able to enjoy a clearer view of the natural phenomenon.
